actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.
Mr. Tauzin moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 277.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
actions.text: Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection

official_title: Recognizing the important contributions of the Hispanic Chamber of Commerce.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that it is important to the promotion of the free market process of the United States, to the future success of Hispanic Americans, and to society at large that the special role of the Hispanic Chamber of Commerce of the United States be recognized and further cultivated to the benefit of all Americans.

titles.title: Recognizing the important contributions of the Hispanic Chamber of Commerce.
